audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Describes optimization of data analysis function - converting hours of manual work to instant access. Replicable pattern for other data-intensive organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Vague quantification ('hours' vs 'instantly') without specific metrics. Source appears to be vendor case study which may have marketing bias.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Clear functional optimization but lacks specific time savings metrics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimizes information retrieval function - making game statistics and performance data instantly accessible. Pattern applicable to other analytics-heavy organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific about speed ('within seconds') but lacks baseline comparison metrics. Vendor case study context raises credibility questions.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Good process description but needs stronger quantitative evidence

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of data retrieval processes, eliminating manual work and enabling faster decision-making. Highly replicable pattern across data-driven organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (Team Liquid), specific process improvement (eliminates manual data retrieval), traceable to authoritative source.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Strong strategic fit and adequate evidence quality for capability optimization

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Dramatic optimization of match preparation process - 96% time reduction (4 days to 1 hour). Highly replicable for other competitive analysis contexts.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization, specific quantified improvement, attributed to team member (Milanov). Strong evidence quality.
audited_claims.notes: Excellent example of Tier 1 optimization with strong quantitative evidence

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: This is a hypothetical value statement about potential prize money, not a description of functional optimization or process improvement.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Speculative claim ('could mean') rather than actual achieved improvement. No evidence of realized benefit.
audited_claims.notes: Not a capability case - describes potential value rather than actual process optimization

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Historical performance data, not a description of AI-driven process optimization or capability improvement.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Factual organizational background information but not relevant to AI capability assessment.
audited_claims.notes: Background information, not a capability optimization claim

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Describes data volume/scale but not process optimization or efficiency improvement. No before/after comparison or improvement claim.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics about data processing volume but no claim of optimization or improvement over previous methods.
audited_claims.notes: Data scale description, not a capability improvement claim

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. Claims C1-C4 describe optimization of existing analytical and strategic preparation functions rather than business model changes or new revenue streams.
